title: Check argument types
body:
### What is the problem?

The function `get_content_annexinfo` takes a single argument that is described to be a list of strings or `None`, and will return status information for each element addressed in the list or  status information about each element in the dataset.

If a string is provided as parameter, the function behaves as if `None` was provided, thus returning status information about each element in the dataset. This is clearly unspecified behavior (other functions might behave in unexpected ways as well if unexpected parameter types are supplied, leading to performance problems or inconsistencies, although that is just a guess and has to be confirmed).

It would be good to ensure type-compliance in the called function, e.g. by asserting types or by `typing.cast`. That would detect certain classes of faulty use and potentially increase stability.

This issue is related to or #6075 


### What steps will reproduce the problem?

Call me `get_content_annexinfo` with a string as argument.
